speaker.whotheyare: Craig Costello uses mathematics to secure the digital world, both against the threats that exist today and those that may exist in the future.
speaker.whylisten: Together with his colleagues, Craig Costello builds software with the goal of safeguarding the internet before large-scale quantum computing becomes a reality. He is a senior researcher in the Cryptography and Security Group at Microsoft Research in the USA. He is primarily interested in the cryptographic applications of computational number theory, in particular curve-, pairing- and lattice-based cryptography.
